title: Repeated Factors
text: To allow for the repeated factor of $$(x-7)$$, the decomposition will include two denominators: $$(x-7)$$ and $$\left(x-7\right)^2$$

title: Separating Denominator Factors
text: Separate the denominator factors and give each numerator a symbolic label like A and B

title: Separating Denominator Factors
text: The equation should now look like: $$\frac{5-x}{\left(x-7\right)^2}=\frac{A}{x-7}+\frac{B}{\left(x-7\right)^2}$$

title: Eliminating Fractions
text: Multiply both sides of the equation by the common denominator to eliminate the fractions. The resulting equation is $$5-x=A\left(x-7\right)+B$$

title: System of Equations
text: Expand the right side of the equation and collect like terms, and then set up a system of equations associating corresponding coefficients.

title: Solving Equations
text: The two equations are $$-1=A$$ and $$5=-7A+B$$. Plug $$A=7$$ into the second equation to solve for B. What is B equal to?

title: Partial Fraction Decomposition
text: What is the partial fraction decomposition after plugging in the values for A and B?
